headline: How Banamex Deal Rejection and Digital Push Could Reshape Citigroup's (C) Long-Term Value Strategy
summary: Citigroup recently rejected a US$9.3 billion acquisition offer from Grupo Mexico for its Mexican retail unit Banamex, opting instead to continue with its previously announced plan to sell a 25% stake to Fernando Chico Pardo and pursue an initial public offering for the remaining business. This decision highlights Citigroup's emphasis on restructuring and unlocking shareholder value in the longer term, while the company's ongoing developments in digital payments innovation signal a broader...

headline: Big Bank earnings: What to watch from JPMorgan, Citi, & more
summary: Big Bank earnings (XLF) are kicking off next week, with Goldman Sachs (GS), JPMorgan Chase (JPM), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Citi (C) reporting on Tuesday, Oct. 14. Bank of America (BAC) will report on Wednesday, Oct. 15. Whalen Global Advisors chairman, Chris Whalen, sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss what he will be watching for as Big Bank earnings roll out. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: How Does the Recent Rally Impact Citigroup’s True Value in 2025?
summary: If you’ve been following Citigroup recently and are trying to decide whether to buy, hold, or sell, you’re definitely not alone. This bank has been turning heads, thanks in part to its impressive multi-year rally. The share price is up more than 150% over the past three years and an eye-popping 164.6% in the last five. Those are the kind of numbers that would get any investor’s attention, even factoring in the recent pause. Over just the last week and month, shares dipped a modest 1.5%. But...

headline: Market Minute 10-10-25- Retail Piles into Stocks as China Restricts Rare Earths
summary: After intraday reversals to the downside yesterday, equities and precious metals are trading slightly higher today. Crude oil is lower, though, along with the dollar. Bonds are bouncing.

headline: Citi rejects Grupo Mexico’s $9.3B offer for Banamex
summary: The bank continued to show support for an earlier bid from billionaire Fernando Chico Pardo to take a 25% stake in the Mexican lender, in combination with an initial public offering.
